content.value: public void AddAttachment(string name, byte[] value, string mediaType = "application/octet-stream")
Public Sub AddAttachment(name As String, value As Byte(), mediaType As String = "application/octet-stream")

parameters.description: The name of the attachment
The value of the attachment
The media type of the attachment; defaults to "application/octet-stream"

children.remarks: The mediaType value must be in the MIME "type/subtype" form, and does not support parameter values. The subtype is allowed to have a single "+" to denote specialization of the subtype (i.e., "application/xhtml+xml"). For more information on media types, see https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc2045#section-5.1.
children.summary: Adds an attachment that is a binary value (represented by a byte array and media type).

The value of the attachment

children.summary: Adds an attachment that is a string value.

children.summary: Adds a warning to the test result.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property Attachments As IReadOnlyDictionary(Of String, TestAttachment)

children.summary: Gets the attachments for the current test, if the engine is currently in the process of running a test; will return null outside of the context of a test.
Attempt to cancel the currently executing test, if one is executing. This will signal the for cancellation.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property CancellationToken As CancellationToken

children.summary: Gets the cancellation token that is used to indicate that the test run should be aborted. Async tests should pass this along to any async functions that support cancellation tokens, to help speed up the cancellation process.

content.value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Current As ITestContext

children.summary: Gets the current test context. If called outside of the text discovery or execution path, will return a test context that is in the stage. The current test context is a "snapshot in time" for when this/ property is called, so do not cache the instance across a single method boundary (or else/ you run the risk of having an out-of-date context).

content.value: Public Function GetFixture(fixtureType As Type) As ValueTask(Of Object)

parameters.description: The exact type of the fixture

children.remarks: This may be a fixture attached via , , or .
children.summary: Gets a fixture that was attached to the test class. Will return null if there is no exact match for the requested fixture type, or if there is no test class (that is, if returns null).

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property KeyValueStorage As Dictionary(Of String, Object)

children.remarks: This storage system is purely for communication between extension points. The values in here are thrown away after the pipeline execution is complete. It is strongly recommend that extensions either prefix their key names or use guaranteed unique IDs like GUIDs, to prevent collisions with other extension authors.
children.summary: Stores key/value pairs that are available across all stages of the pipeline. Can be used to communicate between extensions at different execution stages, in both directions, as a single storage container is used for the entire pipeline.
Gets the current test pipeline stage.

parameters.description: The message to send

children.summary: Sends a diagnostic message. Will only be visible if the end user has enabled diagnostic messages. See https://xunit.net/docs/configuration-files for configuration information.

children.summary: Sets the test context for test framework initialization. This is the moment before any specific assembly is being discovered or run. This is typically used by custom runners just before they create the test framework via a call to .

content.value: public static void SetForTest(ITest test, TestEngineStatus testStatus, CancellationToken cancellationToken, TestResultState? testState = null, ITestOutputHelper? testOutputHelper = null, object? testClassInstance = null)

Public Shared Sub SetForTest(test As ITest, testStatus As TestEngineStatus, cancellationToken As CancellationToken, testState As TestResultState = Nothing, testOutputHelper As ITestOutputHelper = Nothing, testClassInstance As Object = Nothing)

parameters.description: The test that is being executed
The test status (valid values: , , and )
The cancellation token used to cancel execution
The state of the test (only required when testStatus is ).
The test output helper that the test can use to write output. Must be passed when testStatus is ; can be null for other statuses (as it will be pulled from the existing test context).
The instance of the test class (may be null for static class and before the test class has been created)

children.summary: Sets the test context for execution of a test. This assumes an existing test context already exists from which it can pull the diagnostic and internal diagnostic message sinks.

children.summary: Sets the test context for execution of a test method. This assumes an existing test context already exists from which it can pull the diagnostic and internal diagnostic message sinks.

children.remarks: When running with the default test framework implementation, the value here is likely to implement .
children.summary: Gets the current test, if the engine is currently in the process of running a test; will return null outside of the context of a test.

children.remarks: When running with the default test framework implementation, the value here is likely to implement .
children.summary: Gets the current test assembly, if the engine is currently in the process of running or discovering tests in assembly; will return null out of this context (this typically means the test framework itself is being created and initialized).
Gets the current test engine status for the test assembly.

children.remarks: When running with the default test framework implementation, the value here is likely to implement .
children.summary: Gets the current test case, if the engine is currently in the process of running a test case; will return null outside of the context of a test case.
Gets the current test engine status for the test case. Will only be available when is not null.

children.remarks: When running with the default test framework implementation, the value here is likely to implement .
children.summary: Gets the current test method, if the engine is currently in the process of running a test class; will return null outside of the context of a test class. Note that not all test framework implementations require that tests be based on classes, so this value may be null even if is not null.

children.remarks: This value will only be available when is and is , and only after the test class has been created. It will become null again immediately after the test class has been disposed.
children.summary: Gets the instance of the test class; will return null outside of the context of a test. Static test methods do not create test class instances, so this will always be null for static test methods.
Gets the current test engine status for the test class. Will only be available when is not null.

children.remarks: When running with the default test framework implementation, the value here is likely to implement .
children.summary: Gets the current test collection, if the engine is currently in the process of running a test collection; will return null outside of the context of a test collection.
Gets the current test engine status for the test collection. Will only be available when is not null.

children.remarks: When running with the default test framework implementation, the value here is likely to implement .
children.summary: Gets the current test method, if the engine is currently in the process of running a test method; will return null outside of the context of a test method. Note that not all test framework implementations require that tests be based on methods, so this value may be null even if is not null.
Gets the current test engine status for the test method. Will only be available when is not null.

Gets the output helper, which can be used to add output to the test. Will only be available when is not null. Note that the value may still be null when is not null, if the test framework implementation does not provide output helper support.
Gets the current state of the test. Will only be available after the test has finished running.
Gets the current test engine status for the test. Will only be available when is not null.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property Warnings As IReadOnlyList(Of String)

children.summary: Gets the set of warnings associated with the current test. Will only be available when is not null; will also return null if there have been no warnings issued.

summary: Represents information about the current state of the test engine. It may be available at various points during the execution pipeline, so consumers must always take care to ensure that they check for null values from the various properties.

content.value: public sealed class TestContext : ITestContext, IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class TestContext Implements ITestContext, IDisposable
